metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the win-def:sid_test is properly supported.
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the win-def:sid_test.

notes.note: It is important to note that the values used in this test definition are specific to a particular machine, and may not necessarily apply to your system. As a result, in order to have the definition return a result of 'true', you must either change these values to the ones found on your particular system, or you must configure your system to use these values.

Information regarding the groups and users on your particular machine can be found by navigating to Start -> Run... and by typing 'mmc' and adding the Local Users and Groups Snap-in by navigating to File -> Add/Remove Snap-in -> Add -> Local Users and Groups.

criterion.comment: Test that a sid_object with a trustee_name is supported.
Test that a sid_object with a trustee_name pattern match is supported.
Test that a sid_object with not equals is supported.
Test that the include_group behavior is supported.
Test that the resolve_group behavior is supported.

sid_test.comment: Test that a sid_object with a trustee_name is supported.
Test that a sid_object with a trustee_name pattern match is supported.
Test that a sid_object with not equals is supported.
Test that the include_group behavior is supported.
Test that the resolve_group behavior is supported.

sid_object.comment: Retrieves a sid_object where the trustee_name equals the 'CREATOR GROUP SERVER'.
Retrieves a sid_object where the trustee_name matches the regular expression 'CREATOR.*'.
Retrieves a sid_object where the trustee_name does not equal 'ADMINISTRATOR'.
Retrieves a sid_object where the trustee_name equals 'Guests', resolve_group = true, and include_group = true.
Retrieves a sid_object where the trustee_name equals 'Guests', and resolve_group = true.

sid_state.comment: This state represents a sid_object where the trustee_name equals 'CREATOR GROUP SERVER'.
This state represents a sid_object where the trustee_name matches the regular expression 'CREATOR.*'.
This state represents a sid_object where the trustee_name is not equal to 'ADMINISTRATOR'.
This state represents a sid_object where the trustee_name matches the regular expression '.*Guest', resolve_group = true, and include_group = true.
This state represents a sid_object where the trustee_name matches the regular expression '.*Guest', and resolve_group = true.
